intro: Kitchingia miniata, commonly known as the dwarf kitchingia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly found in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
